page.title: 19CHANGING TIMES (b)
page.content: They said that drug addiction was never heard of fifty years ago and violence was very rare, mugging of old people was unheard of.The older people blamed television, lack of jobs and modern pressures of life for these types of anti-social activities.Lack of jobs can be partly blamed on pit closures and increased mechanisation on the local farms.A large number of the young unemployed said that they had never had a job and were absolutely bored.Many people were moving away in search of employment sometimes as far as London.Some local people blamed the Government for the unemployment whilst others thought that many would not have work, even if offered.
